Pre-Game Insights: India have done well in the ICC T20 World Cup, winning three out of their four matches.
Zimbabwe have blown hot and cold in the tournament.
A win would assure India of a place in the semi-finals as the group toppers.
Zimbabwe will bank on their pace attack to pave the way for a surprise win.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch at the MCG is a decent one to bat on with the average score being 160.
Chasing could be the preferred option, with the pitch not likely to change much during the course of the game.
Wickets in hand will be key, with the dimensions of the ground also bound to come into play.
Others: Regis Chakabva has been moved around in the Zimbabwean batting unit but to little avail.
Virat Kohli is the leading runscorer in the tournament at the time of writing with 220 runs in four matches.
Sikandar Raza is Zimbabwe's go-to player with both the bat and ball, with 185 runs and nine wickets to his name in seven matches.
Arshdeep Singh has been India's best pacer in this T20 World Cup, picking up nine wickets in just four matches.
